context_of_use: This use case allows managers to review and approve or reject orders as part of the business workflow.
stakeholders_and_interests: manager: Ensure timely approval of orders to avoid delays in business processes.
description: This use case enables managers to approve or reject orders, facilitating efficient business operations.
triggering_event: Manager initiates the order approval process.
preconditions: Manager is logged into the system.
postconditions: Selected orders are approved or rejected.
Order status is updated in the system.
assumptions: The manager has the necessary permissions to approve orders.
The system has a mechanism to display pending orders for approval.
requirements_met: The system shall allow managers to approve orders.
The system shall update order status upon approval or rejection.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the criteria for order approval or rejection.
main_flow: 1. Manager reviews pending orders → System displays order details.
2. Manager selects an order to approve → System updates the order status to approved.
3. Manager confirms the approval → System notifies the user of the approval.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 2): If the manager rejects the order, the system updates the order status to rejected and notifies the user.
